intro.description: In this cheatsheet we will see how to add a field to a report by editing the query of its main dataset. To add a field we have to edit the query of the main dataset of the report.

item.title: Open a report
item.description: Open a report or create a new one, even blank. A report without field it is suggested.

item.title: Go into the Outline tab
item.description: With the report opened, move into its outline tab.

item.title: Edit the report query
item.description: Now you need to enter in the main query editor, to do this select the report element in the Outline view and from the Properties view hit the button Edit query, filter and sort options

item.title: Select the dataset
item.description: From the current dialog, select in the upper left corner the dataset Sample DB.

item.title: Insert the query
item.description: Insert the query select count(orderid), year(shippeddate) from orders group by year(shippeddate), this will extract from the database the number of shipment done in every year.

item.title: Read the fields
item.description: Hit the Read Fields button to discover the new fields using the provided query. If it is all right two fields should be discovered, C1 and C2. Then hit Ok. Fields button to discover the new fields using the provided query. If it is all right two fields should be discovered, C1 and C2. Then hit Ok.

item.title: Place the field
item.description: In the outline view now you can find the two new fields, under the Fields element. Drag and drop them inside the detail band of the report.

item.title: Run the report
item.description: The new fields are now placed into the report through two text fields, you can execute the report and see the result.
